intro: Onosma setosa subsp. hispanica, commonly known as the Spanish onion or hispanic narrowleaf betony, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, such as limestone soils and open woodlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental qualities and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
